content.description:
High quality and rarely climbed. I started left hand low around the corner on the arete in a pocket and right hand crimp. Hard slapping and squeezing gets you up the blunt arete. Great classic Castle Rock slopers and squeezing.

A lower start seems possible, but at least a few grades harder. The old book gives this a V4, but felt at least V5+ even by Castle Rock standards.
content.location: Right between The Block on Castle Rock and The Beak Traverse.

content.description: Start right of the normal Waimea Wall start and use a series of crimps as you work your feet up the two big diagonal rampy ledges. Top out on the right side of the top ledge. Not as reachy as the standard route but much much harder.
content.protection: at least one pad and a spotter

content.description: Reachy or dynamic face to ledge then downclimb a V0- r.Down and left of the top rope crack "Farewell to Arms".
Start right on the good hand holds, traverse left slightly, then pull straight over the bulge. Great warm up.
content.location: Right between Bate's Arete and The Spoon

content.description: Start with a bat-hang with two hands on a prominent flake. Work your way up onto the ledge.
content.location: The short cave feature across from Waimea Wall.

content.description: Ultra low ball fun problem straight across from the Weimea Wall V1. Start on the left side of the rock. Then heel hook your way all the way across and top out on the right side of the rock.
content.protection: Boulder pad is nice underneath the climber even though they are only 2 feet off the ground
content.location: Small, low, long flat boulder opposite Weimea Wall on Castle Rock Proper. If your looking at Weimea Wall your probably sitting on this boulder.

content.description: This is a traverse inside the cave at castle rock.  Start on the far left side and move up and right over the boulder, transitioning lower after 6 feet to the switch moves across the back of the cave.  Finish by moving up on jugs to the top of the roof.
content.location: left side of the cave, the route moves along about 4 feet above the boulder on the left across a blank wall

content.description: Stand or sit start on the arete left of "Waimea Wall" and slap and hook your way up over the slopey top out to a big ledge - then downclimb V0- r!

From a low start, with a right hand on the arete and a left slopy-crimp, delicately move up to a bad sloper on the arete. Continue to move along the slopers on the arete before making a large move to a final sloper just at the upper left corner to the boulder.  The detached small boulders at your feet are off.  Crux is the last move to the final sloper.  Alternate beta includes topping out following the sloper on top.
content.location: Located on the Duct Tape Boulder, uphill in the cave behind the Spoon (on Castle Rock proper).

content.description:
Start on good underclings. Move into the cave and find a way to turn around (or don't). Good toe and heel hooks will take you to a big move up to the nice ledge. Mantle.

All the necessary and good holds are nice quality. A good brushing first might be needed.
content.protection: Pad and spotters for the finish.
content.location: 5ft right of The Spoon. On the same boulder as Duct Tape.

content.description: Start low on the arete, move up out of the roof, and finish up the slopey arete.
content.location: 50ft right of Waimea Wall on the right side of the cave on Castle Rock proper.

climbs.name: Between a Stump and a Hard Place

content.description:
Start on the good underclings and go straight up to the ledge. Move a bit left then mantle.

Heavy climbers be careful on the right hand starting hold. I think it was wiggling on me.
content.location: 5ft to the right of The Spoon. On the same boulder as Duct Tape.
